titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an Piero Sraffa, [3. 9. 1939]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Abschrift McGuinness, Kopie in BA. Publiziert (WiC, S. 308).

div.p: I take it that you’ll by now be in Cambridge. I’ve come here to see Drury. It isn’t a holiday for I’m not very well & what happens now is enough to make a healthy man sick. I enclose a picture which I want you to keep. I have hardly any hope that anything but the worst will happen. If peace is declared on Poland I don’t know what I’ll do. I hope to see you soon in any case.
